intro: Cinnagrostis densiflora, commonly known as the denseflower cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sunny environments such as meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with serrated edges, and its flowers are arranged in dense clusters. Cinnagrostis densiflora is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local pollinator populations.
